com.yantra.api.omp.order

Interface cancelMasterOrder

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.OMPApi, YIFApi

    public interface cancelMasterOrder

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document cancelMasterOrder(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The cancelMasterOrder API is used to stop and cancel a master order.

    • Method Detail

      • cancelMasterOrder

        org.w3c.dom.Document cancelMasterOrder(YFSEnvironment env,
                                       org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                       java.rmi.RemoteException

        The cancelMasterOrder API is used to stop and cancel a master order. The API will attempt to cancel as many lines as it can based on the input. If a line has already begun its process (order already created for the line), then the line will move to Completed status and have its LastIterationSeqNo set to the last iteration that ran. If the line has yet to be processed, the line will be canceled and both LastIterationSeqNo and FirstIterationSeqNo will be set to the last iteration that ran. Modification rules for canceling a line and changing iterations will be checked.

        If a line is a bundle parent, all its components will be considered for cancellation. If a line is dependent on another line, the dependent lines will also be considered for cancellation. Services (either provided or delivery) associatied to a line will not be considered for cancellation. These lines will have to be passed into the input of this API as well.

        Related Yantra Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: See changeOrder API for more details.

        Events Raised:

        ORDER_CHANGE.ON_CANCEL
        Template Support: Yes
        Configuration Required for backward compatibility: No

        Audits: Configurable

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: Yes

        Database Extensibility Support: Yes

        Configuration Required for Backward Compatibility: No

        Additional Information:

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document that contains the details of the order cancelled. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.

        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Yantra exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
